description: '''Tereza Ana Kesovija''' ({{IPA|sh|terěːza âna kesǒʋija|pron}}; born 3 October 1938) is an internationally acclaimed [[Croatia|Croatian]] recording artist. She was one of the most recognizable figures on the music scene in [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|the former Yugoslavia]] and is renowned for her wide vocal range and operatic style. She also had a successful career in [[France]]. She has held many concerts around the world, being one of the few Yugoslav musicians to have sold out shows in [[The Royal Albert Hall]], [[L'Olympia]] and [[Carnegie Hall]]. She appeared twice as an entrant in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]], representing [[Monaco]] in [[Eurovision Song Contest 1966|1966]] and Yugoslavia in [[Eurovision Song Contest 1972|1972]].
